Package nl.han.ica.oopg.view

Class View

java.lang.Object
nl.han.ica.oopg.view.View
public class View
extends java.lang.Object
The view draws the world and displays the generated viewport on screen.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    View​(int worldWidth, int worldHeight)
    Basic constructor of the view which creates its own viewPort which shows the entire world.
    View​(Viewport viewport, int worldWidth, int worldHeight)
    Create a new view object with an exsisting Viewport.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void draw​(processing.core.PGraphics g, TileMap tileMap, java.util.List<GameObject> gameObjects, java.util.List<Dashboard> dashboards)
    The main draw method of the engine.
    Viewport getViewport()
    Gets the Viewport.
    int getWorldHeight()
    Gets the world height.
    int getWorldWidth()
    Gets the world width.
    void setBackground​(int r, int g, int b)
    Sets the background color of your game in RGB format which is used in the draw method.
    void setBackground​(processing.core.PImage pImage)
    Sets the background image.
    void setPGraphicsCreator​(PGraphicsCreator pGraphicsCreator)
    Sets the PGraphicsCreator which can create the canvas where to draw on.
    void setViewport​(Viewport viewport)
    Sets the Viewport.
    void setWorldSize​(int worldWidth, int worldHeight)
    Sets the size of the world which will be the canvas all the objects will be drawn on before the viewPort is generated.

  • Constructor Details

    • View

      public View​(int worldWidth, int worldHeight)
      Basic constructor of the view which creates its own viewPort which shows the entire world.
      Parameters:
      worldWidth - The width of the world in which all the objects will be drawn.
      worldHeight - The height of the world in which all the objects will be drawn.

    • View

      public View​(Viewport viewport, int worldWidth, int worldHeight)
      Create a new view object with an exsisting Viewport.
      Parameters:
      viewport - The instance of viewPort which generates what is shown of the world
      worldWidth - The width of the world in which all the objects will be drawn.
      worldHeight - The height of the world in which all the objects will be drawn.

  • Method Details

    • draw

      public void draw​(processing.core.PGraphics g, TileMap tileMap, java.util.List<GameObject> gameObjects, java.util.List<Dashboard> dashboards)
      The main draw method of the engine. It will be called by de engine and handles calling all the draw methods of the objects it gets in the parameters. It also handles the generation of the Viewport.
      Parameters:
      g - The canvas on which the view will be drawn.
      tileMap - The instance of tileMap which will be drawn after the background and before the gameObjects and the generation of the viewPort
      gameObjects - The array with instances of gameObjects which will be drawn after the tileMap and before the viewport is generated
      dashboards - The array with instances of dashboards which will be drawn after the viewport is generated

    • setWorldSize

      public void setWorldSize​(int worldWidth, int worldHeight)
      Sets the size of the world which will be the canvas all the objects will be drawn on before the viewPort is generated.
      Parameters:
      worldWidth - The width of the world in which all the objects will be drawn.
      worldHeight - The height of the world in which all the objects will be drawn.

    • getWorldWidth

      public int getWorldWidth()
      Gets the world width.
      Returns:
      The width of the world in which all the objects will be drawn.

    • getWorldHeight

      public int getWorldHeight()
      Gets the world height.
      Returns:
      The height of the world in which all the objects will be drawn.

    • setBackground

      public void setBackground​(int r, int g, int b)
      Sets the background color of your game in RGB format which is used in the draw method.
      Parameters:
      r - Red.
      g - Green.
      b - Blue.

    • setBackground

      public void setBackground​(processing.core.PImage pImage)
      Sets the background image.
      Parameters:
      pImage - The Image which is drawn as background for your game.

    • getViewport

      public Viewport getViewport()
      Gets the Viewport.
      Returns:
      The viewPort which is currently used by the view.

    • setViewport

      public void setViewport​(Viewport viewport)
      Sets the Viewport.
      Parameters:
      viewport - An instance of viewPort to change the viewPorts behavior.

    • setPGraphicsCreator

      public void setPGraphicsCreator​(PGraphicsCreator pGraphicsCreator)
      Sets the PGraphicsCreator which can create the canvas where to draw on.
      Parameters:
      pGraphicsCreator - The PGraphicsCreator
